intro: Malache troyana, commonly known as the Troyan Malache, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soil and full sun. Malache troyana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
